conversations.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<|Function_Thought|>
I need to complete the user's task of adding a public SSH key to their GitHub account. First, I'll list the directory contents in "/system/.ssh" to find the public SSH key file. Then, I'll read its content and use that content to add the SSH key to the GitHub account. I'll proceed with the first function in the trajectory plan: listing the directory.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[list_directory(path="/system/.ssh")]<|/Function_Call|>

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<|Function_Thought|>
The directory listing shows two files: 'id_rsa' (the private key) and 'id_rsa.pub' (the public key). I need to read the contents of the 'id_rsa.pub' file to obtain the public SSH key, which I will then use to add to the user's GitHub account. I'll proceed with reading the 'id_rsa.pub' file.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]<|/Function_Call|>

<|Function_Thought|>
I have successfully read the contents of the 'id_rsa.pub' file, which contains the public SSH key: `ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr`. The next step is to use this public SSH key to add it to the user's GitHub account. I will now proceed with the git_add_ssh_key function to add this key.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]<|/Function_Call|>
You should verify your account first. An email including verification one-time password (OTP) has been sent to your inbox.

<|Function_Thought|>
The public SSH key has been attempted to be added, but I need to verify the account first. An email containing a one-time password (OTP) has been sent to the inbox. I will retrieve the received emails to look for the OTP email. 
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[get_received_emails()]<|/Function_Call|>

<|Function_Call|>[verify_github_account(otp="876053")]<|/Function_Call|>
